title: Addiction Free Treatment Act of 1999
content: Addiction Free Treatment Act of 1999 - Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act and the Public Health Service Act to prohibit the use of certain funds under such Acts for any drug treatment or rehabilitation program that uses methadone or Levo-Alpha Acetyl-Methadol unless the program follows specified guidelines, including that the program has as its primary objective the elimination of drug addiction and that it conducts random and frequent comprehensive drug testing for all narcotics. Requires: (1) the Director of the National Institute of Drug Abuse to conduct a study regarding the effectiveness of non-pharmacological heroin rehabilitation programs and methadone-to-abstinence programs. And (2) the Secretary of Health and Human Services to submit annual reports to Congress over a five-year period on heroin rehabilitation program effectiveness.
